# dokploy_volume_backup (Resource)

Manages volume backups in Dokploy for backing up Docker volumes from applications, databases, and compose services.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `app_name` (String) Docker app/service name (the appName field from the service resource).
- `cron_expression` (String) Cron schedule for backups (e.g., '0 3 * * *' for daily at 3 AM).
- `destination_id` (String) ID of the backup destination (S3, MinIO, etc.).
- `name` (String) Name of the volume backup configuration.
- `prefix` (String) Prefix for backup files in the destination storage.
- `service_id` (String) ID of the service to backup (application_id, postgres_id, mysql_id, etc. based on service_type).
- `service_type` (String) Type of service to backup: application, postgres, mysql, mariadb, mongo, redis, or compose.
- `volume_name` (String) Name of the Docker volume to backup.

### Optional

- `enabled` (Boolean) Whether the backup schedule is enabled. Default: true.
- `keep_latest_count` (Number) Number of recent backups to keep. Older backups are automatically deleted. Default: 5.
- `service_name` (String) Service name within a compose stack. Required when service_type is 'compose'.
- `turn_off` (Boolean) Whether to stop the service during backup for data consistency. Default: false.

### Read-Only

- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the volume backup was created.
- `id` (String) Unique identifier for the volume backup.
